Description: Hollow gold bangle made of thin sheet gold beaten into shape on a wooden ring. The two ends were joined to form a three-sided hoop with an open internal face, onto which was soldered a thin sheet gold strip. No further decoration or inscription has been added.
Curator's comments: With a miniature granite torso (1966,0418.1), gold 'awaw'-bangle (1872,0604.1099) and a miniature gold 'shebyu'-collar (1872,0604.690).
Bibliography: A. Wilkinson, 'Ancient Egyptian Jewellery' (London, 1971), p. 101. Egypt’s Golden Age (exhibition catalogue, Boston, 1982): 243 [326]
Forms a pair with identical EA 66841
Bibliographic references: Museum of Fine Arts Boston 1982 / Egypt's Golden Age: The Art of Living in the New Kingdom 1558-1085 BC (326)
